rows.text_1:
One-on-One Time can be fun for you and your child.

Let’s look at how {F2_GRANDMOTHER} and {F2_DAUGHTER_3} do this!

rows.text_2:
*{F2_DAUGHTER_3} and {F2_GRANDMOTHER} are starting One-on-One Time.* 
**{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: “I have 5 minutes of One-on-One Time to spend with you, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. What would you like to do?”
**{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: “I want to play dress-up!”
**{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: “Wonderful idea, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}! I see you are taking out the yellow scarf with blue stripes on it.”

**{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: “{F2_GRANDMOTHER}, it’s for you.”
**{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: “Thank you, I love it!”
**{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: “Wear it, {F2_GRANDMOTHER}!”

{F2_DAUGHTER_3} finds a dress to wear.
**{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: “Well done for getting dressed by yourself, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. You are such a big girl!”

rows.text_1: Let’s reflect on what we saw.
rows.quiz_1_question: **How does {F2_GRANDMOTHER} show {F2_DAUGHTER_3} that she is paying attention?**
rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: Yes, she does all these things! This way, {F2_DAUGHTER_3} knows that {F2_GRANDMOTHER} really cares about her.
rows.quiz_1_option_2_text: She goes down to the same level as {F2_DAUGHTER_3}
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: Yes, she does all these things! This way, {F2_DAUGHTER_3} knows that {F2_GRANDMOTHER} really cares about her.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: Yes, she does all these things! This way, {F2_DAUGHTER_3} knows that {F2_GRANDMOTHER} really cares about her.
rows.quiz_1_option_4_text: She asks what  {F2_DAUGHTER_3} wants to do
rows.quiz_1_feedback_4: Yes, she does all these things! This way, {F2_DAUGHTER_3} knows that {F2_GRANDMOTHER} really cares about her.
rows.quiz_1_option_5_text: She allows {F2_DAUGHTER_3} to choose the activity
rows.quiz_1_feedback_5: Yes, she does all these things! This way, {F2_DAUGHTER_3} knows that {F2_GRANDMOTHER} really cares about her.
rows.quiz_1_option_6_text: She notices and praises what {F2_DAUGHTER_3} does
rows.quiz_1_feedback_6: Yes, she does all these things! This way, {F2_DAUGHTER_3} knows that {F2_GRANDMOTHER} really cares about her.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_1: That is right. Spending One-on-One Time has a big positive impact on how your child feels.

rows.quiz_3_feedback_1: Yes! Spending time with our children helps us to connect with them. We can enjoy time together without thinking of our daily chores or worries for that moment.
